content.text: Write the number two million eight hundred and forty thousand three hundred and twenty-seven in figures
Write down the mathematical name of this type of angle
Measure the length of this line in millimetres
Draw a line perpendicular to this line
In triangle \(PQR\), \(PR = 5 \text{ cm}\) and \(QR = 4 \text{ cm}\)
**Using a ruler and compasses only**, construct triangle \(PQR\)
Leave in your construction arcs
The side \(PQ\) has been drawn for you
Write down a common multiple of 18 and 24
Write \(32 \text{ cm}\) as a fraction of \(2 \text{ m}\)
Give your answer in its simplest form
Which city has the coldest temperature?
What is the difference in temperature between Helsinki and Paris?
The temperature, in \(^\circ \mathrm{C}\), is recorded at the same time in six cities
The diagram shows two straight lines intersecting two parallel lines
Find the value of \(x\)
Divide \(\)200\(in the ratio 7:3
Complete the stem-and-leaf diagram to show this information
Key: 2 | 1 represents 2.1 kg
Find the median
The birth weights, in kg, of 11 babies are recorded
Show that 60 cars are blue
The rest of the cars are either red or white
110 cars are red
Complete the pie chart to show this information
Victoria records the colour of each of 240 cars leaving a car park
Some of this information is shown in the pie chart
The price of a computer is \(\)520
This price is reduced by \(15\%\) in a sale
Work out the sale price
Without using a calculator, work out \(\frac{1}{3} +\frac{5}{6}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form
Find the probability that a car is not faulty
In one week Mario tests 850 cars
Find the number of cars that are expected to be faulty
Mario tests new cars
The probability that a car is faulty is 0.04
A café sells 330 sandwiches
This is \(\frac{11}{14}\) of the sandwiches they make
Work out the number of sandwiches the café makes
Complete the table of values for \(y = \frac{5}{x}\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = \frac{5}{x}\) for \(-5 \leqslant x \leqslant -1\) and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 5\)
Write down the term to term rule for this sequence
\(P = \{\quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad \quad\) }
\(\mathrm{n}(P\cup Q) =\)
The Venn diagram shows the elements of the sets \(\mathcal{E}\), \(P\) and \(Q\)
Complete the statements
The bearing of \(A\) from \(B\) is \(137^{\circ}\)
Find the bearing of \(B\) from \(A\)
Write 0.00273 in standard form
Sam has to answer this question
Sam writes \(42.1 \times 10^{6}\) as his answer to this question
What two errors has Sam made?
Error 1
Error 2
Triangle \(ABC\) is mathematically similar to triangle \(DEF\)
Find \(BC\)
The diagram shows a right-angled triangle
Show that the value of \(x\) is 15.8, correct to 3 significant figures
Natalie buys 4 tomato plants and 3 pepper plants for \(9.35\)
Samir buys 2 tomato plants and 11 pepper plants for \(16.55\)
Write down a pair of simultaneous equations and solve them to find the cost of one tomato plant and the cost of one pepper plant
You must show all your working
Tomato plant
Pepper plant
